a.g: By the sky and the night comer -
And what can make you know what is the night comer?
There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
So let man observe from what he was created.
He was created from a fluid, ejected,
Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
Indeed, Allah, to return him [to life], is Able.
The Day when secrets will be put on trial,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وهذا أمر ينكشف ﴿ يوم تبلى السرائر ﴾ ويوم يبعثر ما في القبور ويحصل ما في الصدور، فعند ذلك تتميز السبيكة الخالصة من البهرجة فنعوذ بالله من الخزي يوم العرض الأكبر.
Indeed, this matter will be unveiled **[yawma tubla as-sara'ir]** on the day when the secrets [as-sara'ir] are tested, and the day when what is in the graves is scattered and what is in the breasts [as-sudur] is attained. At that time, the pure ingot [as-sabikah] will be distinguished from the tinsel [al-bahrajah]. So we seek refuge in Allah from disgrace on the day of the greatest presentation [al-'ard al-akbar].

a.g: Then man will have no power or any helper.
And [by] the earth which cracks open,
Indeed, the Qur'an is a decisive statement,
Indeed, they are planning a plan,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد حذر الله تعالى من مكره واستدراجه فقال "فلا يأمن مكر الله إلا القوم الخاسرون" وقال تعالى "ومكروا مكراً ومكرنا مكراً وهم لا يشعرون" وقال عز وجل "ومكروا ومكر الله والله خير الماكرين" وقال تعالى "إنهم يكيدون كيداً وأكيد كيداً فمهل الكافرين أمهلهم رويداً" فكما لا يجوز للعبد المهمل أن يستدل بإهمال السيد إياه وتمكينه من النعم على حب السيد، بل ينبغي أن يحذر أن يكون ذلك مكراً منه وكيداً مع أن السيد لم يحذره مكر نفسه، فبأن يجب ذلك في حق الله تعالى مع تحذيره استدراجه أولى، فإذن من أمن مكر الله فهو مغتر، ومنشأ هذا الغرور أنه استدل بنعم الدنيا على أنه كريم عند ذلك المنعم، واحتمل أن يكون ذلك دليل الهوان ولكن ذلك الاحتمال لا يوافق الهوى، فالشيطان بواسطة الهوى يميل بالقلب إلى ما يرافقه وهو التصديق بدلالته على الكرامة وهذا هو حد الغرور.
Indeed, God the Exalted has warned of His guile [makr] and His gradual enticement [istidraj], saying: "So none feels secure from the plan of God except the people who are losers." And He the Exalted said: "And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "And they planned, and God planned. And God is the best of planners." And He the Exalted said: "Indeed, they are planning a plan, and I am planning a plan. So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile." Therefore, just as it is not permissible for the heedless servant [al-'abd al-muhmal] to infer from the master's neglect of him and enabling him with blessings that this indicates the master's love for him—rather, he should fear that this is guile [makr] and a plot [kaid] from him, even though the master did not warn him of his own guile—then how much more incumbent is this regarding God the Exalted, along with His warning of His gradual enticement [istidraj]? It is more fitting. Thus, whoever feels secure from the guile [makr] of God is deluded [maghṭūr]. The origin of this delusion [ghurūr] is that he inferred from the blessings of the world [al-dunyā] that he is held in honor [karīm] with that Bestower. Yet it is possible that this is evidence of degradation [hawān]. But that possibility does not agree with the lower self [al-hawā]. So Satan, by means of the lower self [al-hawā], inclines the heart [al-qalb] towards what accords with it, which is believing its indication of honor [karāmah]. And this is the definition of delusion [ghurūr].

a.g: But I am planning a plan.
So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.
